title: Are Orthodox considered Christian by Protestants? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on which Protestants and what they mean by “Christian”. But generally the answer is yes, members of Orthodox churches are certainly considered Christians. The major ecumenical organization is the World Council of Churches. It has more than 300 WCC member churches, including Eastern Orthodox and Oriental Orthodox groups. Member churches must hold to a Trinitarian formulation of the deity so that would preclude certain religious organizations like the Latter Day Saints (Mormons), Jehovah Witnesses, and Unitarian Universalists. Oddly enough the world’s largest Christian church, the Roman Catholic Church, is not a member of the WCC itself though it is a founding member of the WCC’s Faith & Order Commission. As I recall the reasons are not because of disagreement with the theological principles—the RCC is definitely Trinitarian—but has to do with how the WCC fits in with the RCC’s ecumenical goals.

I’m not sure what you mean by Orthodox unless it’s the Orthodox Church itself. Christian orthodoxy is the fundamentals of the Christian faith: The Trinity, the deity of Christ, Creation by God, the sinful nature of mankind, verbal plenary inspiration of scripture, the blood atonement of Christ, His bodily resurrection on the 3rd day, personal salvation by grace through faith and repentance of sin. We, “Protestants” which does not include New Testament Baptist churches, agree that anyone who preaches and practices these basic beliefs with the same understanding of terminology are Christian.

Today the word Protestant is a term used to distinguish certain Christians from Romans and also from the Orthodox. In other words, Protestant means not-Roman and not-Orthodox. Consequently, the term Protestant says nothing about what any Protestant thinks or believes about anything. There are Protestants who think that Romans and Orthodox are Christians too. There are Protestants who think one them is authentically Christian but the other not. And, some Protestants think neither Romans nor Orthodox are Christians. Indeed, there are many Protestants who think that their version of Protestantism is the only true Christian faith, and all other Protestants are not Christians!
